treatment.description: pappi of orbiculate to lanceolate, arcuate, involute (glabrous or villous) scales 1–6.5 mm, usually 1–6 mm shorter than cypselae. 2n = 18., slightly constricted below flaring, filled by embryos or distal 1/4–1/2 empty), ribs slightly flared apically, cypselae columnar, 4–10 mm (tapered to basal callosities).

habitat_info.text: clay soils, flats and hillsides, often by vernal pools or near serpentine outcrops, grasslands and open oak and Pinus sabiniana woodlands;
habitat_info.habitat: often by vernal pools or near serpentine outcrops, grasslands and open oak and Pinus sabiniana woodlands

treatment.discussion: Subspecies douglasii is the common subspecies away from the coast in cismontane California, north of the Transverse Ranges; it is relatively rare in southwestern California and southern Oregon. Some populations near the coast appear to be hybrids between it, or subsp. tenella, and Microseris bigelovii.
